korean: 오늘은 날씨가 정말 추워서 두껍게 입고 나갔다.
귀도 시려워서 귀마개 했어야 했는데 안 가져왔다.
카페에 들어가서 따뜻한 아메리카노 마시니까 좀 녹는 기분이었다.
밖에 있는 사람들 다 움츠러들고 빨리빨리 걷더라.
나도 볼일 빨리 보고 집으로 왔어.
집에 와서 따뜻한 차를 마시니까 살 것 같다.
보일러 온도 높이고 이불 덮으니까 천국이야.
내일도 춥다는데 내일은 그냥 집에만 있어야겠다.
english: It was really cold today, so I went out bundled up.
I wore my puffer jacket, scarf, and gloves—the whole deal.
The wind was cold and my face felt numb.
My ears were freezing too. I should've brought earmuffs, but I didn't.
I carried warm hand warmers in my pockets.
Still, my hands and feet were frozen solid. It was rough.
I went into a cafe and had a hot americano, and I could feel myself thawing out.
Everyone outside was hunched over and walking super fast.
I finished my errands quickly and came straight home.
Coming home and drinking warm tea, I feel alive again.
Turning up the heater and getting under the blankets—it's heaven.
They say it's gonna be cold tomorrow too. I think I'll just stay home.
